inn1.comm: lovely start from Bresnan, a bit of movement, and that's all you need, jagging away past Kamran's outside edge
a very good ball is followed by a slightly poor one as Bresnan drifts down the leg side
back on to the off-stump line, Kamran almost looks secure as he defends to point
again Bresnan drifts into the legs and this thuds off the pads and dribbles down to fine leg
Kamran is away with a gentle push past extra cover, no great extravagance but it was a safely played shot
carefully defended to cover
Bresnan digs it in a touch shorter, Kamran is up on his toes, drops it by his feet in the leg side and scampers through for a single
Anderson marks the occasion by dishing up a fullish half-volley that is stroked firmly to mid-off
very nicely played here, Anderson arrows into leg stump and Kamran flicks away with a style through square leg for four
Anderson's response is good, heading for the top of off before Kamran intercepted with a quiet defence
big appeal from Anderson as he spears in a fuller ball that traps Kamran on the pads, heading down though
this is gun-barrel straight - both the line and the lac of movement in the air or off the wicket
defended crisply into the covers, by the looks of things this is a flat and easy paced wicket begging for runs, but it's only been two overs
nicely played here, Hafeez stands tall and strokes a single wide of mid-off
back of a length from Bresnan, Akmal carefully behind it
good line from Bresnan but there is nothing in the pitch to concern the batsmen
touch fuller from the bowler and Kamran plays a touch loosely across the line and can only get an inside edge that trickles away by his feet
shot! Very neatly done again from Kamran, flicking a shortish ball with perfect timing through square leg for a boundary
this is even better! Bresnan overcompensates, and goes too full, Kamran greets it with the straightest of blades, timing it perfectly down the ground for four
Anderson is not racing in, in these conditions I think he realises control is his only weapon, and the line is good and carefully defended
Hafeez seems like a man who won't be hurried as he eases into a gentle forward block
slight change of length with Anderson forcing Hafeez back to defend
Hafeez looks fairly secure but doesn't seem able to rotate the strike
another dot ball as Hafeez prods carefully to  point
maiden over, and a good 'un from Anderson, Hafeez defending everything
dreamy shot from Kamran here, nothing hectic or rushed about it, just leaning a drive through point with perfect timing
"That's a riposte!" coos Miller, and it was, Bresnan landing a top delivery that pitches middle and jags away, leaping past the outside edge
oh dear, poor ball and Kamran takes full toll, down the leg side and Kamran fiddles it round the corner to collect four more
this time it's carefully defended
four more! Didn't time it perfectly but still beat a sprawling mid-off with a firm drive, Kamran racing along here
good finish to a very expensive over from Bresnan, finding the right line length and line that Akmal can only defend
Anderson continues to test Hafeez with straight deliveries, and it's again defended carefully
good lengths from Anderson, not dropping short, just keeping things very simple and Hafeez defends uneasily to point
you sensed this was coming! Hafeez was getting tied down and tries to break the shackles with a pull shot, didn't really get much of it but still cleared short midwicket for a couple
good response, fuller and angling in, almost squeezed through the defences but Hafeez got an inside edge on time
Hafeez sets off for an absolutely suicidal single, clipping the ball straight to short fine leg and tearing away before being very firmly sent back by Kamran
Anderson completes another good over with Hafeez defending
Kamran continues to attack, skewing an inside edge down to square leg for a couple
don't bowl there, not to anyone, awful delivery from Broad, very short, very wide and Kamran flayed airily to the point boundary
too wide from Kamran again and he cashes in, swinging his arms through the line to slice it over cover
Broad locates the right line and length and is rewarded with a Boycott-like defence from Kamran
slightly fuller and straighter, carefully pushed to mid-on
good finish to another expensive over, with Kamran defending to cover
it's a different game when Hafeez is on strike, he's defending everything
once again Hafeez eases into a defence, there is no intent from him at all
Anderson is enjoying himself here, no pressure at all as Hafeez lines up another defensive block
fraction of width, the sort of thing Kamran would throw his hands at, Hafeez instead works it to point
finally a single is found as Anderson drifts to the legs and is picked off into midwicket
the tactic from Anderson doesn't change though and his length delivery is defended to short cover
Hafeez with a boundary now! Broad drops a touch too short and down the leg side too, Hafeez helps it over square leg and picks up four
driven firmly by Hafeez but he finds short extra
much better delivery, the inbetween length and around off stump, Hafeez blocks
Strauss tumbles as he fields at short midwicket, not sure why it seemed to roll to him very gently
Broad will fume at this! Hafeez's straight drive, which is not timed perfectly by any means has beaten Anderson at mid-off who slid straight past the ball and allowed it to go for four
on a length and line and defended carefully, another good over for Pakistan though
I doubt this was in their discussions, Anderson firing a wide down the leg side
Kamran advances down the track, Anderson sees him coming and drops shorter which means the attempted leg-side flick is missed and it comes off the body for a single
Hafeez is defending watchfully at Anderson's end
Hafeez this time has a shuffle down the wicket, Anderson bangs it in shorter in response and it's defended
huge appeal from Anderson as he traps Hafeez on the back foot with a fuller ball, umpire Doctrove says no and rightly so, the ball was heading just over
oh dear, very sloppy from England, Michael Yardy gets a tough bounce that hops past his hands and gifts a single
stroked away through point for a couple to finish the over
full length, hard-handed drive, genuine edge, a regulation one-day four through third man. Broad doesn't like that one little bit
outside off, jagging away, beats the edge this time
prodded out into the covers, good probing length
short and pretty horrid from Broad. Banged in and angled down the leg-side, nothing more than a roll of the wrists, and backward square can't rescue the situation
better line and length, big stride and a push out to point
a modicum of drama as the two batsmen ponder a quick single to mid-on, but think better of it as the shy comes in. Loose stuff so far from England, and Pakistan have cashed in impressively
poked into the off side
full length, attacking the base of the stumps, dug out to short cover
stand and deliver! A fraction short from Anderson, and Akmal is up on his toes to thread the ball through backward point. Top shot
down the leg-side, England aren't at the races this morning
flicked off the pads, into the gap for a single
pushed off the back foot, out to extra cover
swinging away, down the leg side again. Scattergun stuff
better line and length, defended resolutely with a stiff front leg
short and wide, and gets away with it as a scything cut cuts at thin air
poked out to backward point
outside off, left alone this time
a measured dab into the covers, a long chase for the fielder
short of a length, slower ball, turned into the leg side
outside off, and once again there's too much width on that ball. Met with a calculated push this time, but Pakistan are ticking along
a loose start, a full-toss, patted with some surprise into the covers
better delivery, angling in towards off stump from round the wicket. Clobbered out to point
down the track, a firm strike, clears mid-off, and that's a powerful boundary
back of a length, clipped to midwicket
a swishing drive, out to deep cover for another single
worked up to mid-on with a roll of the wrists
outside off, jabbed out to point off the back foot
tight line from Broad, just back of a length, defended into the gap again
decent rhythm in this over so far. Blocked into the covers off the back foot
pushed to short cover, trying to come forward to that one
short and wide, and that's a fine shot for one, a wristy slap to deep point
outside off, poked out to deep cover. A better over for England, but Pakistan still managed to milk it
floated onto a good length, pushed into the covers
appreciable turn, but worked out to midwicket. Another misfield, this time from Collingwood, which is unusual
better line, driven uppishly to cover
outside off, Akmal misses out on a gliding cut
pushed down the ground off the back foot
good delivery, flight and drift, and sharp spin from a good length. Defended
on a good length, angling towards the off stump
A chance for Anderson as he pounces at midwicket, but he shied at the wrong end!
patted into the covers, and that's Akmal's second fifty in consecutive games, and he's looking a different proposition against the white ball
attempted sweep, no hope of an lbw decision but a hopeful appeal nonetheless
crashed into the covers, another excellent and confident stroke. And that brings about drinks, and not before time from England's point of view
short and wide, and cut with excellent timing through third man
fuller and straighter, worked into the leg-side
smacked into the covers, and another fumble from England's fielders, Anderson again. They've been vacant as a unit this morning
worked to midwicket
driven on the up, back to the bowler
short again, but spinning sharply, cut on the bounce to gully
worked into the leg-side, using the natural angle
patted up to mid-on
swept with good power, straight through square leg. Yardy was halfway up for lbw, but that was met with the full face
reaching for this one, but another measured sweep
tucked off the hip, a loud screech to turn down the second run as Anderson fields
punched into the covers, the runs keep dripping off the scorecard. A 300-plus total has to be the minimum ambition from here
dabbed to short third man
inside-out drive, picked up at midwicket
big spin, too big, as that beats everything and zips away to the fine-leg boundary
driven up to mid-on
better line and length
worked out to the leg side
slung in on a good line and patted up the wicket
drives out past point for  a single
Kamran gets down on one knee and dinks around the corner for a single
Hafeez shaped so early to sweep that he ended up dabbing a juicy full toss for just a single behind square on the leg side
four this time! Good shot from Kamran, waiting on a late cut and thrashing through point
runs flowing as Kamran takes a single to cover to keep the strike. Yardy is proving quite expensive today
flat and quick from Swann, punched to short midwicket
Swann dares some air and is greeted by a full-face push to long-on
good delivery here that almost squeezes through Hafeez's defences
neatly played with soft hands to deep square
bit of turn here, first one we've really seen bite, and it surprised Kamran
this  time it's nurdled round the corner straight to Strauss at short fine leg
starts with a gentle rolled offcutter around off stump that Hafeez strokes to deep cover

Collingwood strikes! The change works for England but Kamran is not happy. He went down to paddle a sweep and was struck just in front of off stump, replays show it a tight but good decision and a much-needed breakthrough for England
very slow cutter to greet him first up, Yousuf had to wait and age before tickling it fine
this holds its line and beats Yousuf outside off
drifting in with the off-cut again, Yousuf leans it to short midwicket
Yousuf is away and he'll keep the strike after dabbing Collingwood easily to deep midwicket
oooh, very big shout here! Yousuf misses a sweep and it trapped in front but the umpire decided against it. Could have gone either way  as replays show it clipping leg stump
this time defended with a straight bat carefully
Yousuf picks off a single into the leg side
Hafeez opens the face and glides towards short third man looking for a single but Yousuf has none of it
nicely played here, worked into the midwicket region for one
this time the Yousuf sweep is played more securely and he collects a single for his effort
touch airy from Yousuf here, chipping down the ground for one
Hafeez waits and waits before poking this to short third man
pushed quietly to cover for a gentle, mid-innings single
good middle-overs milking from Yousuf, pushing  to long-on
Hafeez on the act now, clipping a single to deep midwicket
poor ball from Collingwood, dragged down very short, Yousuf wheels away a pull shot but finds the fielder at fine leg, should have been punished really
lovely shot from Yousuf, opening the face late to a diving beat short third man, Swann wasn't impressed with the effort, but then he rarely is
calmly worked into the leg side
Yousuf takes a big stride out and clips into leg but picks out short midwicket
top-edged sweep, could have been two if Yousuf was quick, but he really isn't
quicker ball slides down the leg side and Davies collects smartly

flat and quicker and Swann has done him! Hafeez was rushed as he went back to try and work it to third man, it cramped him for room, came off the pads and went on to the stumps. Double breakthrough for England!
defends his first ball very calmly
another misfield, there have been so many today, at point as Yousuf cuts
Collingwood's good line is rewarded with careful defence
goodness me, Anderson this time has hashed up a routine stop, he just let this go through him for a single
Yousuf works past short midwicket for a single
cheer from the crowd as an England fielder stops the ball cleanly at deepish point
nicely played here, Yousuf waiting and waiting before opening the face to glide the ball down to third man for a couple
Asad down on one knee and working a sweep shot very neatly away for a couple towards fine leg
slightly quicker from Swann and defended harmlessly into the leg side
bit of a tempter from Swann this time, slower and outside off, Asad resists and instead pushes for a single to cover
Yousuf strikes a languid defence into the off side
shorter and down the leg side from Swann, Yousuf tried to wheel a pull away but couldn't connect, close to a wide you'd think
flatter delivery knocked to square leg
big cheer from the Pakistan crowd, seems a trifle disproportionate as Asad pushes gently past cover for a couple
more of a cheer here, and why not! Asad gives himself a bit of room and cuts airily and powerfully past a diving Swann at short third man for four
this sticks in the wicket a fraction and is pushed back towards the bowler
Asad on the cut again, less room for him here, but doesn't get much of it
Yousuf gets a single, pushing gently into space
Asad blocks to finish another good over for Pakistan
a touch shorter from Swann, Yousuf tickles it easily to fine leg
Asad down the wicket and driving firmly to long-off
Yousuf this time collects a single, quite a sharp one too as he prods to short midwicket
Asad down the wicket looking for something expansive but can only defend
Asad on the cut again, doesn't get more than a bottom edge but it dribbles away for one
Yousuf proves he can mix it with the kids by reverse-sweeping, but doesn't get more than a top edge that goes into Davies' face
pushed out to short cover
launched up and over the leg-side, massive airtime, Morgan hurtles round but can't get his fingers to the chance ...
worked off the toes, out to midwicket
flicked firmly to square leg
clipped again, straight to the fielder
chopped out to backward point
starts with something closer to a jaffa than not! A full, inswinging delivery, big shout, but there was bat and pad involved there. Good nut though
a touch more width, glided down to third man
splice-rattling from a good length, a quick call and Yousuf has to get his rocket-boots on there to make his ground. Which he does
attempted glide, inside-edges, down into the  crease
repeat performance, good angle on the crease, the ball follows Yousuf in towards the stumps as he attempts to glide to third man
gets it right this time, a tame nudge for a single to third man. Better over for Bresnan and England
pushed into the covers, another quick single
dabbed out to point
chopped firmly out towards the cover boundary
down the track and that's the way to do it. The ball was tossed up a touch, Yousuf sauntered towards it, and lifted it effortlessly over long-on
swept, good placement towards fine leg. They opt against the third run
forward and defended
a good attacking full length from Bresnan, no option but to dig it back to the bowler
jags into the pads, and deflects down to third man
good rhythm now from Bresnan, wide of the crease and attacking the base of off
clipped down to third man, a touch shorter in length
jagging off the seam, hits the pad, but Yousuf is across his stumps and outside the line. Good ball though. (Going over the top as well)
poked to point, a good over that from Bressie
tossed up and driven to mid-on
bludgeoned into the deep, fielded at cow corner on the bounce
nicely done, good footwork and an inside-out lift over the covers. Good fielding from Bopara on the cover boundary
reverse sweep, not quite timed or placed
quick single, Yousuf back on strike
a bit of a scuffed lift down the ground, but never in danger of getting him out
short and wide, a poor ball but too well hit to cash in. Morgan intercepts at deep point to cut off a certain four
top shot! A compact lofted drive, up and over long-on and just bounces inside the rope
short ball, pulled, not quite timed
neatly tucked off the hip, just back of a length
short and wide, dabbed down to third man
short again, angling back into the batsman, third man is in business again
slashed up and over cover point, looked like another boundary, but the ball slowed up upon pitching. Lots of backspin on that swipe
nurdled effectively to third man
that's a good ball, one of a rare handful that has genuinely beaten the edge. A cross-seamer, zipping through to the keeper
that's a filthy mow! A swipe over cow corner, sliced to point, should have been a run-out,  but Collingwood fumbled. Sums up England's day
glided through backward point, Bopara can't intercept, and the runs keep coming at a pace. That's the 200 up!
another single, and another much-needed drinks break for England
flicked to short midwicket
tapped into the leg-side
tossed up, and sharp turn. Good bowling
well bowled again, held back a touch in the flight, and turns back into the pads
worked around the corner, into space behind square
tidy over, and just what England need at this stage. Pakistan still well on course for a 300-ish total
bouncer, and a well-directed one. Umpire Llong calls one for the over
a cutter, zipping back into the pads, a scampered single as the ball rolls into the crease
England's standards in the field today have been atrocious. A regulation gather at short cover deflects to extra cover, which is also fumbled! Poor fare, and Broad is chuntering
short, and smoked over midwicket! Fetch that
that's the way to do it. Broad is fuming, hits the deck hard, finds good lift and a modicum of movement, and Davies gathers a thin edge
dabbed into the covers, a quick single, and another wayward shy
driven back up to the bowler
outside off, nibbled down to third man
that is an absolute clobbering! Down the track, a swing of the blade that is reminiscent of Darren Gough at Sydney in 1994-95, and the ball fizzes over long-on!
back into the crease this time, and defended watchfully
Umar returns the compliment, to end Swann's spell
back of a length, neatly dabbed down to third man
Shafiq wants the tip-and-run single into the off side but he's sent back by Umar
full outside off, thrashed out to deep cover

Umar guides the yorker outside off down to third man - a good-looking shot - and, with England still looking a little lacklustre in the field, takes the chance to test the fielder and charge back for the second
nudged into the leg side for another quick single
chopped down behind gully, where the fielder makes a good sliding stop to cut off the run
full offcutter on middle, flicked straight to the man at midwicket
on a length outside off, angled down to third man
frantic running! Shafiq just defended it gently back down the track but Umar was alert to the possibility for a single, sprinting down to beat Anderson's shy at the stumps in his follow through

Umar gets right across outside off, looking to flick the ball away fine. He doesn't get any bat on it but the ball clips the pad and rolls to the fine leg boundary. An appeal for lbw, but the umpire's not the least bit interested
Umar leans into the drive, the ball takes a thick outside edge and bounces down to third man
full on middle, Shafiq looks to work into the leg side but hits the field
back of a length from Bresnan, Umar swivels into a whippy pull - trying to beat short fine leg - but is beaten and struck in the stomach. He's annoyed with himself, the shot was on there
again Umar is struck in the midriff trying to pull, this time the ball rolls into the off side and they steal a quick single
both batsman are looking to beat the field with fine leg up in the circle, Shafiq now getting across to off, and they takes a leg bye as he's hit on the pad
thrashed away behind point! Cracking shot from Umar, reaching for a full, wide delivery and slapping it away very hard
good thinking, he follows the big shot up with a single to rotate the strike
slower-ball bouncer, but Shafiq spots it early, rocking back and drilling a pull out to midwicket
glanced gently just to the left of short fine leg
pushed into the off side, extra cover swoops to cut off the run
glanced uppishly but into the gap, the ball  bounces out to deep square leg
eased down to long-on for an ambled single, Shafiq goes to 49
again Umar flicks in the air through square leg, Bopara rushes in but takes the ball on the bounce as it lands well infront of him
there it is! Fifty for Shafiq, and it's been a fluent, well-composed knock. Chopped down behind point, and they rush through for another quick single

Shafiq goes! Banged in short and wide by Broad - the slower-ball bouncer - and Shafiq tried to uppercut it over cover point. He was undone by the lack of pace really, the ball popping up to be held by a sliding Bopara at point. He's almost taken out by Strauss, who was also running across to attempt the cash, but maintained his composure to hold onto the ball as his captain tumbled over him
the wicket hasn't dented Umar's resolve! The very next ball - full on off stump - he thwacks up and over cover for four
four more! Broad sent down the wide slower bouncer again, but Umar was waiting for it and scythed a cut through the line to send the ball flying away past point

and another! Intelligently played by Umar, picking up the line and length early and just opening the face of the blade to get the ball very fine down to third man. The fielder is in the ring, so that's four

but he's gone now! Very similar to the dismissal of Yousuf, it was a back-of-a-length effort ball from Broad, Umar looked to nudge down to third man but got a thin edge, and Davies behind the stumps did the rest
short on off stump, flapped away to long leg by Alam - the helicopter pull as the ball bounced up to head height - and he's off the mark straight away
full-toss on leg stump, clipped out to deep square
chipped in the air down to long-on, bouncing twice infront of the fielder
adventurous running! Alam just tapped it down right infront of him and Afridi called him through. Anderson sprints forward after his follow-through but can't beat Afridi
lucky for Anderson! A full toss, heading down the leg side, is flicked straight to the man at short fine leg. That could have been a wide, or a boundary if he had got it past that man!
slower ball, right up to the batsman, and he can't get it away
another offcutter, landing on leg stump, and it's clipped out to deep midwicket
slower bouncer, pulled out to deep square
short and wide outside off, Afridi throws the bat at it but can't get a touch on it. He's a little peeved that's not called wide actually. It was certainly marginal
back of a length again, drilled in the air down to long on

that's the way to do it! Alam goes through the off side, where there's no protection on the boundary. It was back of a length again from Broad, he moved away to leg to give himself room and threaded it behind point
quick and rising into the ribs, Alam is hurried into a swivel-pull down to fine leg
lofted down the ground! Afridi flexes his muscles with a strong hit down the ground, clearing the boundary by a couple of metres. Pakistan need a few more of those!
drilled into the off side, straight to the fielder but they steal a single

Afridi falls! It was a full toss fired at leg stump as he stepped away to give himself room. He tried to thrash it in the air, inside-out, over cover, but just sliced at the ball to hit it very high but not too far. Strauss sets himself under the chance, and a wicket falls at a crucial stage of the innings
offcutter, landing on middle and leg, and flicked into the leg side
pushed to cover point, everyone's on the edge of the circle so there's an easy single to be had - but they need boundaries!
Alam steps away to leg, but Anderson follows him and he's cramped for room as he punches into the off side
again, tapped towards cover point and they sprint through for one
slower ball on off stump and it's met by a smashing drive from Gul ... but equally good fielding from England's captain at mid-off saves a boundary there!
back of a length, whipped out to deep midwicket but there's plenty of protection out there
slower ball again from Bresnan, and this time he has the beating of Gul as the batsman aims a massive heave into the leg side. Didn't get anywhere near it
yorker cleans him up! Full, straight and quick from Bresnan, the ball slips under Gul's flashing bat and disturbs the stumps. Another wicket falls in the Powerplay!
slower ball on middle stump, Ajmal gets across to off and flicks to short fine leg
great death bowling from Bresnan! Alam tried to give himself some room, but the yorker was speared down at his toes and he could only dig it out back to the bowler
short, pulled out to long leg where Bopara charges round to keep them to two
slower bouncer this time, Ajmal tries to paddle it past short fine leg but can't beat the fielder - just one run
short again, pulled in the air... but falling just infront of short fine leg! Alam is annoyed, that could so easily have been four
wild swing, top edge, and Strauss takes an easy catch in the covers. What bizarre figures Broad has now!
Alam finds the boundary! It was another wild swing, the ball didn't go quite where he intended but it's the runs that count. Four runs to backward point
full, drilled at mid-off and just a single to finish the innings

inn2.comm: the entire length of Shoaib's run up with cheered on by the Pakistan fans and the delivery was good, on a length and line forcing Strauss to defend
any width and Strauss will murder you, is there a better cutter in the game? Shoaib drops short and Strauss crashes it to the point boundary
edged and drops short of slip! Perfect line, hanging the ball just outside off stump, Strauss just felt for the ball with soft hands but the edge fell short
similar line and length but Strauss has learnt his lesson and leaves well alone
top bowling this from Shoaib, he's settled into the ideal line but also length, not going too short and Strauss hurries to defend
quietly defended back down the wicket to finish a good first over
he really is incredibly tall, and the length is okay here, a faction wide but Davies finds point with his cut
good ball here, finding a touch of extra bounce and Davies blocks
good start from Pakistan in the field, Davies guides a length ball towards point and Asad saves
touch too short from Irfan and Davies climbs into a pull shot, didn't time it perfectly but enough to collect three
good follow up, fuller and straighter, jabbed out to mid-on
nope, don't bowl there, it's very gentle from Irfan, dishing up a long-hop outside off that Davies crunches to the point boundary
good shot from Strauss and England are really away now, Shoaib aims full and Strauss drives through cover confidently
touch lazy this from Strauss, just playing across the line a fraction and picking out short midwicket as he scampers through for one
back of a length from Shoaib, around off stump and Davies defends
a touch uppish from Davies, clipping towards square leg to rotate the strike
pushed carefully to mid-off
Strauss again pushes to mid-off but this time fancies stealing the strike and hurries through for one
massive appeal from the bowler, his huge arms thrust into the clouds as Strauss missed an attempted pull, it flicked his trouser pocket on the way through to Kamran, good decision
short again and Strauss pulls again, this time more securely away for a single to deep square
too short and the line is poor too, giving Davies room to swing his arms through the line and collect a boundary past point
much, much better from Irfan, this is exactly the place to bowl, back of a length, good line and bat-jarring bounce
lucky here for Davies, flapping a pull shot airily and it went one bounce to the man at deep square
Strauss once again steals the strike off the last ball of the over, this time by working into the leg side
wrong line from Shoaib, firing it into the pads and it's picked off into the leg side
Davies this time picks off a single towards the midwicket region, Shoaib beginning to bucket sweat already!
back of a length and flicked towards deep square for one
much better from the bowler, Davies is pinned on the back foot but the length here is full and he defends uneasily
great timing from Davies! Clipped off the pads sweetly and just clearing the man leaping at short midwicket
full and straight to finish and Davies blocks quietly
back of a length and Strauss wheels away a controlled pull shot for a single
Irfan again locates the ideal length and line and Davies can do nothing but defend
top fielding Saeed Ajmal! Not known for his fielding, he's just saved a boundary by diving full length and mid-on to save a well-timed drive from Davies
hints of the YouTube clips here as Strauss jerks his head out the way of a sharpish bouncer from Irfan
Irfan looks to have settled much better this game and forces Strauss back to defend here
fuller ball to finish the over, his best, and it thuds off the pads for a single
hint on width, only a hint and Strauss works it away to third man
crisp pick-up shot finds the boundary, nothing more than a flick of the wrists from Davies and it flies to the fine leg boundary
it's a long way down from 7"1 and Irfan couldn't get there, Davies whips it round the corner and it goes through the legs for another boundary
better line and Davies can only defend to cover
gone! Shoaib strikes! Top work from the veteran, good length just angling across the left hander, finds a faint edge and Kamran holds on!
ooh, lucky he did mark that guard carefully, Trott leaves alone and watches the ball whistles past close to his off stump
Irfan hung this out invitingly outside off stump and Strauss mullered it, but straight to the man at point
loose from Strauss, looking to cut and the ball was too full for the shot, ended up swishing and missing
beaten again! Much fuller this time, Strauss tries to squeeze a square drive away but fails to connect
more secure here, worked to deep square to rotate the strike
good delivery to the new man, heading to the top of off and Trott defends carefully
good over ends with Trott defending to cover
Strauss gets away with one here! Big leading edge as Strauss plays across the line again but the edge loops a long way over the infield towards the extra-cover boundary
cracker! Seaming away from the left hander and beating Strauss all ends up
short ball that Strauss doesn't quite get hold of, muffling a pull shot to short third man, Irfan ends up in an awkward heap but manages to stop the ball
whipped off the legs firmly but straight to short midwicket
Boom Boom Strauss! That's what they should call him, he saunters down the wicket and clubs it with complete gracelessness down the ground for four
dropped by Irfan! He looks the wrong man to field in that area, Strauss flicked it off his legs straight at him and the chance goes down
Trott blocks a good ball carefully into the leg side
must be difficult for the bowler to hold his confidence after spilling that catch but he's started this over well and Trott defends quietly once more
Trott's away, whipping a pull shot off his eyes down to deep square
Strauss really is in Boom Boom mood, he's wandered down the wicket again and aimed an enormous swipe at thin air
great fielding from Umar Gul on the fine leg boundary, sliding full length as Strauss clips a full toss around the corner
Strauss guides this shortish ball down to third man for a single
swinging away outside the off stump. Crashed through to covers and picked up by the sweeper
outside off, jabbed to gully with an open face
plays this late, and taps it down to third man for another single
crunched out towards the cover boundary, off the back foot
turned off the hip, out to midwicket
driven on the up and into the covers
tucked off the toes, out to midwicket
banged in short, pulled out to midwicket without much timing
pushed back to the bowler
that's a dirty great swipe outside off, and a thin inside-edge trickles through to the keeper. A slower ball, I believe
that's a fantastic strike. Advanced down the track and outside the leg stump, a big swing of the bat, and that's carved over point for a precious boundary
canny batting, walks across his stumps this time, and flicks a shin-high full-toss to deep midwicket
good delivery, full length, swinging away, and Strauss wafts flat-footedly
skiddy delivery, onto the legs, flicked to midwicket
curvy bowling, swinging appreciably from middle to off, jabbed into the gully
whipped to midwicket, full length again
chopped hard to deep point. Runs keep ticking along at the moment
genuine edge from a hard-handed drive. Late outswing deceives the batsman, but there's no third man, so the best ball of the over is also the most expensive.
pushed to mid-on, cautiously watched
on the pads, can't work with the angle
cramped for room on the legs again. Strauss looks to the heavens after missing out
good use of the feet, but only a single as Afridi intercepts at short midwicket
watched onto the middle of the bat from deep in the crease
a flash outside off and Trott misses out on a boundary-ball there. It was short and wide, but he snatched at the offering
thrashed in the air, but Yousuf at mid-off never looked like getting close. And sure enough he doesn't

what a take from Kamran Akmal! A massive deflection, Akmal dives full-stretch to his right, clings onto a blinder, but it's not given out! How it went in that direction without bat, we'll never know ...
a measured defence
open-faced steer through backward point
dicey again, this time from Trott, who is beaten by extra bounce on off stump, and nearly deflects onto his leg stump ... tricky times for England
full length and swinging towards the toes ... picked up at mid-on
twirled onto a good length, blocked into the covers
tossed up again and driven back to the bowler
on the pads, shovelled to Yousuf at backward square, who manages to field cleanly
pushed on the up to mid-on
outside off, feathered through the gap and away to the backward point boundary. Strauss just uses the pace to good effect
flapped round the corner, picked up at square leg
outside off, feinting past the edge with subtle outswing. Good bowling
banged in short, Strauss stands tall and chops out to deep point
flicked around the corner, no trouble with that single
leading edge, and that is so nearly the breakthrough! Turned inside-out with an attempted flick, and short cover couldn't quite make up the ground
down the leg-side, a waste
swished out to backward point
tapped back down the pitch to end a mostly tidy over
whippy delivery, onto middle and leg, defended
flapped round the corner, not entirely timed, but a run nonetheless
worked into the covers
outside off, Trott waits for it to spin and taps the ball wide of Yousuf at point, who pounced with the mobility of a Marwell Zoo lion
fizzing delivery, pinned on the pads, but that was sneaking down the leg side
worked out to point
dabbed into the gully, Trott's in no rush as yet. And in other news, a bear has defecated in the woods
tapped down to third man, one more to the cause
picks the gap at midwicket with a firm clip
chiselled out to midwicket with a hop across the stumps
outside off, clipped to deep midwicket. One away from his half-century now
attempted drive, a slight inside-edge
forward and driven into the covers
drilled in the same direction, same result as short cover intervenes
that's the other way to do it! A quick step down the track, a massive swipe for six, and that's his fifty! Well played, his 23rd in ODIs
taps the single to rotate the strike
nudged into the leg side
rocks back to cut to deep cover. That's the end of a successful over for England
nudged into space on the leg side
speared in flat outside off, Trott stays deep in the crease and chops it down to third man
plenty of gaps in the field now, Trott simply punches through the off side and they're back for two
topspinner on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
slightly leg side from Ajmal, Trott bends into a sweep but can't get it away
good end to the over, as Ajmal lands the doosra on leg stump and Trott drives to mid-on
a stiff-looking Shoaib labours to the crease and hurls down a sub-80mph loosener... It'll take him a while to get warmed-up again by the looks of things
width offered outside off, Trott is quite happy to pick up one with a slap out to deep cover

too short from Shoaib, and with no great pace on the ball it's easily thumped away to deep midwicket ... Alam initially went the wrong way on the boundary but picked the ball up at the last moment and actually ends up doing really well to change direction and dive to his right to save the boundary
angled down to third man
Shoaib's slowly pushing those speeds up, this is the quickest ball of the over and though it's not quite pushing 90mph Strauss is hurried in his whipped-pull and is struck on the thigh
length delivery on leg stump, and nudged into the on side for one
tossed up, but Ajmal errs in line and sends the ball down the leg side from over the wicket ... that must have clipped the pad, as the umpire's not signalled wide
leg-stump line once again, this time Strauss nails the sweep down to fine leg to pick up four
driven uppishly ... but past extra cover and out into the deep for two
speared down the leg side again, and that's another wide. Not the greatest bowling from Ajmal this over, but Kamran's keeping has been spot on. "Melting into the gloves," chirps Sahil
forced out towards point off the back foot
much better line from round the wicket, and Strauss can't do much with that
tapped into space on the off side, and a quick single to end the over
length delivery on leg stump, and it's nudged out to deep square
width offered outside off, but Trott isn't exactly over-attacking at the moment, and taps a cut to backward point
slower delivery, landing full outside off, and Trott works it down to long-on for one
slipping towards leg once again, and it ricochets off the pad down to fine leg
back of a length, outside off, and Trott gets on top of the bounce to play the ball down towards gully
another slow offcutter to finish the over, but Trott spots it and glances out into the leg side for one
Ajmal stays round the wicket to Trott, as the batsman jabs him out to midwicket

nudged towards the vacant mid-on region, there was always a single on but a noteworthy effort from Ajmal - who's been a changed man in the field today. He charged across, picked the ball up, turned and threw the stumps down
an easy single into the leg side
much quicker through the air from Ajmal, but it doesn't make much of a difference as Strauss hangs back and punches into the off side for one
topspinner from round the wicket, Trott comes forward and pushes defensively into the covers
quick single to finish the over, and Trott, who has moved quite anonymously into the 30s, will retain the strike
not the greatest start, short and wide, but there are men out to protect the boundary so just two
full on middle and leg, eased down to long-on
well bowled! Hafeez slows this one up, Strauss was right back on his stumps and that could have been fatal ... had he not jabbed the bat down to pick up a single to cover
keeping slightly low on off stump, but Trott is right behind it in defence all the same
a little too short, Trott hops back in a flash to pull out to midwicket
bottom edge! Strauss had shaped to cut but the ball rushed straight on from round the wicket, bouncing back and just misses the off stump
swept out into the leg side for one

more comedy fielding from Irfan! Strauss charged out and sliced a drive in the air to short third man, there was no chance for a catch as the ball bounced infront of him but it landed and spun away ... Irfan was wrong-footed, and tumbled over as the ball rolled past
leading edge! But again it falls safely at mid-off
driven out to deep cover
the singles are flowing - as they have been for some time - and Trott picks up another into the leg side
glanced down to fine leg for another
Hafeez stays round the wicket, Strauss drills a full ball back to the bowler
he gets it past him this time to pick up one to long-on
full outside off, Trott opens the face of the bat to send the ball behind square on the off side
too short, and Strauss aims the short-arm jab out to deep midwicket
driven back to Hafeez's left, the bowler does well to dive and stop the run this time
full on middle, flicked into the leg side but straight to midwicket
quick and full on off stump, firmly punched to cover
Strauss comes down the track and eases the ball out to square leg
hurled way down the leg side, and even though Kamran's having a good day behind the stumps he can't do anything about that. Afridi's not happy, but that was a pretty bad ball
quick and on a good length on middle, Trott can't work this anywhere
swept down to Irfan at fine leg, big cheer from the crowd but he fields cleanly
the ball's following him around! Strauss late cuts to Irfan, who is at short third man for the left-hander. A little fumble has the crowd chortling once again
guided down on the off side but straight to short third man, no run
punched out to deep cover
nicely driven by Trott, beating the inner ring but long-off runs round to keep them to one
there's just no stopping these singles, and Strauss is in no trouble just pushing this into the covers
a rare risky shot from Trott! He backed right away to leg and chopped a full ball down past gully ... but if he'd missed that it would have clattered into middle stump
Strauss uses his feet and forces into the covers
Trott is changing gears now, picking up the length early and nailing the slog sweep out to deep midwicket! Great placement, and a timely boundary
not a great start, he's slid this down the leg side, gets more encouragement from his captain but he looks nervous
much better here, outside off stump and Strauss has a big yahoo at it and misses
four this time, not quite where Strauss intended but the delivery probably deserved it, full toss outside off that Strauss edges to the third man boundary
pretty poor this from Irfan, no pace, width outside off and Strauss crashes through point
four more! Short ball, no venom or pace on it, Strauss climbs into a pull shot and without quite timing it, picks up a boundary despite a valiant diving effort from Gul on the midwicket boundary
easily guided to third man for a single
better ball to finish a pretty dreadful over, Trott pushes to cover
no boundary here, instead a fiddle into the leg side for a swift single
nicely bowled, quicker and Trott was awkward in defence
swept firmly behind square for one
Strauss gets deep into his crease, works it off his pads to midwicket and walks a single

Trott top-edges a sweep that sails one-bounce to the hapless Irfan who, true to form, fumbles a routine pick up and allows Trott to come back for his second and bring up another 50, he's played very well again
quietly defended to finish the over
another single for Strauss, tickled around the corner
Trott gives himself a fraction of room but a quicker ball stops anything bar careful defence
powerful sweep is fielded very smartly on the square leg boundary

oh dear! All kinds of confusion and Trott could be run out here! Yes, he's gone by a distance. There was a massive lbw appeal when he was trapped in front after missing a sweep, umpire Docktrove declined once more but Trott wandered down the pitch aimlessly and the throw came on from short third man to catch him short! It was Shoaib with the throw as well! Pakistan really needed that!
skips down the wicket first ball and clips to Afridi at short midwicket
Collingwood gets off the mark by popping the ball to point and scampering a single
shortish ball and Collingwood clubs a cut shot to deep point to bring Strauss on strike
Strauss stays rooted on 99, blocking carefully back to the bowler
that is Strauss's hundred! Brilliant innings, guiding the chase superbly so far, he gets there by dinking the ball to midwicket. His 5th ODI hundred and he got there quickly too
Collingwood defends very securely
single taken, pushed to deep point
Strauss ticks over another single, working the ball around the corner and can reward himself with a drink
just a fraction short and Strauss hammered a pull to deep midwicket
good length and line here from Gul, testing Collingwood around off stump
this is classic Collingwood, getting inside the line and nurdling the ball down to fine leg
just back of a length, good line too and Strauss can only defend
dragged down a touch too short, Strauss controls a pull shot for another single
Collingwood keeps the strike with a single pushed off the back foot to deep point
Ajmal has troubled Collingwood all summer and here it's defended carefully
Collingwood doesn't pick a doosra and it skews off the leading edge as he skips down the wicket trying to clip to leg
Strauss would have been furious if he got out playing this, trying to drink a reverse sweep away, getting a top edge, with the short third man in place that's an awful shot
much better this time, working with a straight bat to leg
Ajmal beats Collingwood again, the batsman is clueless as to which is the doosra and this sneaks past the outside edge
without knowing all that much about it, Collingwood picks off a single towards midwicket
Collingwood blocks very crisply to extra cover where Hafeez, with a chance of running Strauss out, refuses to throw the ball, there was no one backing up, in his defence
this time Collingwood drives off the front foot, picking out extra cover once more
single taken, pushed away into space
very full from Gul, but no hint of movement - reverse or otherwise - and Strauss drives to mid-off
Strauss advances down the wicket and has an enormous swipe at a short ball, but fails to connect
Gul feeds another short and wide one and this time Strauss doesn't miss out, cutting crisply and picking out the gap square of third man for a boundary
starts with a fullish ball that Collingwood knocks to long-on and jogs a single
Strauss advances and nibbles the ball to deep midwicket for another single
good running from Strauss, getting back to the bowler's end for a couple as Collingwood clips to leg
Collingwood advances and Afridi sees him coming and darts it in quicker, comes off Collingwood's boot and dribbles towards short fine leg
not a great delivery, full toss that Collingwood's bunts to deep square where some swift fielding on the boundary keeps it to two
single to finish, Collingwood milking very effectively
Collingwood slices a drive to deep third man and has enough time to come back for a second
good delivery cramping Collingwood for room and he defends to Afridi at short mid-on
hint of width, Collingwood cuts firmly to point to rotate the strike
Strauss aims a big slog-sweep but the quicker and flatter ball beats him
good delivery here cramping Strauss as he tried to cut and he gets a thickish edge that dribbles away
couple for Strauss, getting deep into his crease and cutting firmly
top shot from Collingwood, using his feet nicely to skip down the wicket and clip to long-on for a couple

Collingwood down the wicket again but gets a leading edge as he tries to slap into the leg side, looped down to long-on where Azhar Ali, on as a substitute fielder, pouched the simple chance! Pakistan still fighting!
Strauss has strike with the batsmen crossing and knocks a single
Morgan cuts his first ball straight to point
quicker ball races on to the thigh and Akmal fumbles the take
good over ends with Morgan defending uneasily
eased out to long-off for one
speared in flat on off stump, Morgan stays deep and taps into the leg side
driving out to a sliding Fawad Alam at deep cover
England have run Pakistan's fielders ragged today, and now they pick up two more as Shoaib struggles round from long-on
drilled down to Shoaib at long-on once again
edged, and dropped by Kamran! It was a really thick edge and a big deflection as Morgan tried to cut, the keeper did well to even get a glove to that

glanced to fine leg, and Yousuf fires in a throw ... Kamran has the bails off in a flash and they appeal for the run out. This is going to go to the third umpire ...  but Morgan's lightning quick between the wickets and he's safely home
flicked out to square leg for one
a thick outside edge rolls to Akhtar at short third man, but its to his left and so a quick single is on offer
eased down to long-on for one
Strauss skips down the track and whips out to deep midwicket, they briefly think about the second but it's deemed too risky
a touch short outside off - the offspinner from Afridi - and easily cut out to cover point
carved out through the covers, it's to the left of the sweeper and they come back for an easy two

sloppy fielding from Umar Gul! That should've been a dot ball as the ball went straight to him at straight midwicket inside the circle, but it hits the boot and rolls into the outfield to give away two
full on leg stump, and neatly worked into the leg side for another
Strauss makes room, backing away to leg, and punches out to deep cover off the back foot
hurled down the leg side, and Shoaib will have to bowl that one again
dropped down infront of square on the off side, and with the field spread that's an easy single
clipped out to deep midwicket and England continue to inch towards this total
Strauss skips down and clips the ball off his toes and down to fine leg
Morgan can't get this away, an important dot ball - but they need some more of those
full toss on leg stump, and Strauss accepts the gift to pick up one to midwicket
tip-and-run into the covers from Morgan, and yet another single
too too easy for Strauss, another single out to deep midwicket and Pakistan are looking a little toothless here
flighted on leg stump, Strauss comes down the track but can't get to the pitch

Ajmal strikes, Doctrove finally gives one! That was plumb infront though, quick and very full. Strauss was down to sweep and the ball would have smashed into the middle of off stump had his pad not got in the way... Pakistan aren't out of this yet
Ajmal comes round the wicket to the right-handed Bopara, the arm ball rushing straight on and it's angled down towards point
Bopara is off the mark, nudging to wide mid-on for one
you don't see this too often - Morgan tries the reverse-sweep but can't lay bat on ball!
ha! That's more like it! Again Morgan lines up the reverse-sweep, but this time he nails it up and over backward point, a couple of bounces and away to the boundary
that is very full on middle, but not quite the yorker and Bopara gets across to glance that out to long leg for two
Gul's not bowling to his field here - back of a length outside off and all Bopara has to do is run it down past short third man to pick up an easy four
slower ball, on a length outside off and Bopara drops it down towards gully for one

Morgan goes, and that could  be the key wicket! It was full and angling across the left-hander, he tried to go over the top but sliced the ball high and out to the man on the point boundary. This could get very tight, England's premier finisher departs!
high full toss down the leg side, Kamran does well to stop that but it's still a wide so that has to be bowled again. And they ran a single!
good running, Yardy just opens the face on a length delivery and Bopara immediately calls him through as the ball rolls to backward point
low, dipping full toss on off stump, Bopara drives down to long-on to keep the strike

caressed out to the cover boundary by Bopara! That's a great shot under pressure, Ajmal came round the wicket and Bopara just leaned forward into the drive and very nearly picked up a boundary there, good fielding on the ropes too
pushed down to long-on for one
threaded between midwicket and mid-on for another single
shot! Yardy takes a step towards the leg side to give himself some room and crashes the square drive out to the cover point boundary
quick doosra on middle, the ball takes the inside half of the bat and rolls to midwicket
Yardy makes room once again, but this time the drive isn't nearly as well timed and rolls to mid-off
length delivery, muscled out into the leg side with a short-arm jab! But Asad is out there and sprints round to keep them to two
dot ball! It was a slower ball from Gul, Bopara just about picked it in time but could only tap it back to the bowler

another slower one! This has been a good over so far from Gul. Bopara backs away to leg but he's deceived by the pace, the ball shoots past the edge and bounces to Kamran between the batsman and the stumps
quick this time, and he was aiming for the yorker there! Didn't quite get it right, but it was full enough that Bopara couldn't get under it - just one to long-on

lofted, what a strike from Yardy! He's moving around all over the place in the crease as Umar runs up to bowl, eventually he goes very deep and across to the off side, getting underneath a length delivery and lofting out to straight midwicket

leading edge, but it loops just over the man at cover! Again Yardy went across to off, closing the face of the bat too early as he tried to smash through the leg side once again. But he survives and England are edging ahead now!

tremendous effort from Hafeez running across from long-off! Bopara tried to crash this straight back over his head but got right underneath it to send a steepling chance towards long-off ... Hafeez had a lot to do as he ran in from the boundary, but he slid into position to hold on and that's a vital strike for Pakistan. Ajmal is proving his worth at the death!
not the best of follow-ups, as Ajmal spears a fast doosra down the leg side
swept hard towards Yousuf at short fine leg, but he gets down in time to cut that off, just the one
Ajmal comes round the wicket, but Bresnan - calm as you like - just steps to leg and crunches the ball out to the cover boundary
Bresnan tries to drive off the front foot this time, but he's picked out point
how has that missed the stumps? Bresnan tried to heave this into the leg side but was beaten by the topspinner, and the ball bounced just over the top of middle and leg
drilled down to long-off, just the single and Bresnan keeps the strike
superb yorker! Right in the blockhole, full and fast. Bresnan jams down on it very hard but Gul leaps in his follow through to cut it off
he's bowled a wide! The pressure is getting to Gul here, he charges in and sprays this very wide on the off side
bouncer, top-edged, and England drawl level as the ball loops up and over Kamran and bounces away to the boundary!
drilled to mid-off, Alam fires a throw at the stumps but misses and England are home!
